title: School Change Models and Professional Learning Community-Based Instructional Improvement

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of educational policies and school administration, understanding of secondary education systems
context.additional_context: Exploration of school change models and pedagogical improvement strategies for social studies education, emphasizing learners' critical thinking and practical classroom application skills

learning_goals: Analyze the three-stage process of the School Change Model and develop an action plan applicable to educational settings

Learners form a 3–5 member Professional Learning Community (PLC), conduct weekly online meetings for one semester, and design one instructional improvement plan incorporating peer feedback (≥2 instances), submitting an implementation plan (≥3 stages) and performance report (≥80% rubric compliance)
Develop the ability to create customized educational programs tailored to learners from diverse socioeconomic backgrounds
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
